title: Chromosome 9, Tetrasomy 9p: A Rare Chromosomal Disorder
short_description: Clinical overview of Tetrasomy 9p, a rare chromosomal disorder where the short arm of chromosome 9 appears four times instead of twice.
long_description: This document provides a clinical description of Chromosome 9, Tetrasomy 9p, an extremely rare chromosomal disorder characterized by the presence of four copies of the short arm of chromosome 9 (9p) instead of the normal two copies. The condition affects the normal chromosomal makeup (karyotype) and appears to have a slight male predominance. With only approximately 30 cases reported in medical literature, this disorder represents a significant chromosomal abnormality that requires specialized genetic understanding and clinical management.
